salmonrun.title: Overtime
salmonrun.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 200%. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Make sure all players select "?" as their weapon (This is the default option).

Players will work together to clear the shift. Everyone wins if you clear all 3 waves.

When submitting results, enter Win if you cleared all 3 waves or Lose if you failed to clear all 3 waves.

understaffed.title: Under Staffed
understaffed.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 150% and set the map to Sockeye Station. Players may select any weapon they'd like for this minigame.

Uh-Oh! Your coworkers didn't show up to work today. Mr. Grizz isn't going to take that as an excuse to not make your quota though. 2 players will work together to clear the shift. Both players win if you clear all 3 waves.

When submitting results, enter Win if you cleared all 3 waves or Lose if you failed to clear all 3 waves.

salmonrun1v3.title: Corporate Sabotage
salmonrun1v3.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 125% and the map to Spawning Grounds. Make sure all players select "?" as their weapon (This is the default option).

{Player} is a "Thrower." The other 3 players will attempt to clear the shift to win. If the shift is failed, the thrower will win. Use any (in game) means necessary to secure victory!

When submitting results, if you cleared the shift, enter Win, otherwise enter Lose.

salmonrunreverse1v3.title: Kindergarten Bullying
salmonrunreverse1v3.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 15% and the map to Salmonid Smokeyard. Players with a red name on the results page must select "?" as their weapon. The other player may select any weapon they'd like.

{Player}, {Player}, and {Player} are "Throwers" attempting to lose the shift. The other player is trying to clear the shift by themself. If the shift is failed, the throwers will win. Use any (in game) means necessary to secure victory!

When submitting results, if you cleared the shift, enter Win, otherwise enter Lose.

goldeneggs.title: Over Fishing
goldeneggs.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 100% and the map to Bonerattle Arena. Make sure all players select "?" as their weapon (This is the default option).

Players will compete over the course of a salmon run shift to collect the most Golden Eggs. Players will recieve 1 coin for every 3 Golden Eggs collected.

When submitting results, enter the Golden Egg totals on the end screen.

salmonrunrevive.title: Revive Runners
salmonrunrevive.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 200% and the map to Gone Fission Hydroplant. All players must select "?" as their weapon (This is the default option).

Players will compete to get the most Revives during a shift of salmon run.

When submitting results, enter 1st by the player with the most revives on the end screen, enter 2nd by the player with the second most and so on. If 2 players have the same number of revives, give them the same result.

tableturf.title: Tableturf Battle
tableturf.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Tableturf Battle Lobby. You can play online tableturf by heading upstairs in the lobby. The host may pick their favorite map to play on. Set the turn timer to 40 seconds.

Players will compete in a regular tableturf match. Whoever has the most tiles set to their color at the end of the game wins.

When submitting results, enter Win for the winner of the match and Lose for the loser.

gamble.title: Gambling
gamble.description:
This minigame is played individually in the Lobby at the Shellout Machine.

Players will do a single pull from the Shellout Machine. Whoever get the rarest pull will get 1st place, followed by the 2nd rarest and so on. If 2 players get the same pull it is considered a tie.

Rarities are as follows from rarest to most common: Gold, Silver, Bronze, Emote, Party Food Ticket, Pack of Cards, Banner, 2x Food Tickets, 3 Ability Chunks, Title, Stickers, Decorations, 50% Food Ticket, Drink Ticket

When submitting results, enter 1 for the player with the rarest pull, 2 for the 2nd rarest and so on.

speedrun1.title: Speedrun Race (5-6)
speedrun1.description:
This minigame is played individually in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level 5-6: Zipping over the Neighborhood.

Players will play through level 5-6 as quickly as possible, you have 2 attempts to record a time. Play through the level the fastest to win! Your final time will be the time that shows up on the level clear screen. A penalty of 5 seconds will be added for each time you die in game.

When submitting results, enter 1 for the player with the fastest time, 2 for the 2nd fastest and so on. If 2 players have the same time, it is considered a tie. If a player does not remember their time, they are given last place.

speedrun2.title: Speedrun Race (4-3)
speedrun2.description:
This minigame is played individually in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level 4-3: Let's Put a Pin in That.

Players will play through level 4-3 as quickly as possible, you have 2 attempts to record a time. Play through the level the fastest to win! Your final time will be the time that shows up on the level clear screen. A penalty of 5 seconds will be added for each time you die in game.

When submitting results, enter 1 for the player with the fastest time, 2 for the 2nd fastest and so on. If 2 players have the same time, it is considered a tie. If a player does not remember their time, they are given last place.

speedrun3.title: Speedrun Race (6-6)
speedrun3.description:
This minigame is played individually in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level 6-6: Keep It Rolling.

Players will play through level 6-6 as quickly as possible, you have 2 attempts to record a time. Play through the level the fastest to win! Your final time will be the time that shows up on the level clear screen. A penalty of 5 seconds will be added for each time you die in game.

When submitting results, enter 1 for the player with the fastest time, 2 for the 2nd fastest and so on. If 2 players have the same time, it is considered a tie. If a player does not remember their time, they are given last place.

bigbangtiming.title: Mind your Timing
bigbangtiming.description:
This minigame is played individually in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level 1-8 What Caused the Big Bang? YOU!

Players will play through level 1-8 once with their final time being as close to 1:00 as possible. If you die or fail to complete the level on your first try, you will be disqualified and automatically get last place.

When submitting results, enter 1 for the player with the time closest to 1:00 on the end screen, enter 2 for the 2nd closest and so on. If 2 players are the same amount of time away from 1:00, it is considered a tie. If a player does not remember their time, they are given last place.

anarchyopen.title: Anarchy
anarchyopen.description:
This minigame is played together in Anarchy Open.

Players will play one match of Anarchy Open together. Your goal is to win. Simple enough.

When submitting results, enter Win if you won the match or Lose if you lost.

splatzones.title: Passive Ink-come
splatzones.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Splat Zones. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Set the teams to match the groups of players on the results tab.

Players are seperated into 2 teams. Your goal is to score as many points as possible in a game of splat zones. You will recieve 1 Coin for every 10 points your team scores. If a team achieves a knockout, the other team gets 0 coins. Use of voice calls for callouts is permitted.

When submitting results, enter the points scored shown in the battle log by each team. If the score says "Knockout", enter 100 for the winning team and 0 for the losing team.

towercontrol.title: The Squid-sons: Hit & Run
towercontrol.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Tower Control. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Set the teams to match the groups of players on the results tab.

Players are seperated into 2 teams. Your goal is to win the match with your team but if you die to a Reefslider you are permanently dead and must remain in your spawner. Assists with reefslider do not count, only if the kill camera says you died to reefslider. If you accidentally leave your spawner, jump off the map to go back into it. Use of voice calls for callouts is permitted.

When submitting results, enter Win by the winning team and enter Lose by the losing team.

clamblitz1.title: My Teammate's Throwing
clamblitz1.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Clam Blitz. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Set the teams to match the groups of players on the results tab.

{Player} and {Player} are throwers and for them to win they must make their team lose the match. Everyone else must win the match normally. Use of voice calls for callouts is permitted.

When submitting results, enter Win by the team that won and enter Lose by the team that lost.

clamblitz2.title: Selfish Shellfish
clamblitz2.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Clam Blitz. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Randomly divide the players into 2 teams.

Players will be randomly split between 2 teams. Your goal is to achieve the #1 Score Booster medal during a match of clam blitz. You can do this by scoring the most points in the enemy basket. On each team there will be 1 winner and 1 loser as each team will have 1 player that recieves the medal in the battle history. In the case where 2 players on a team both recieve the #1 Score Booster medal, both will be awarded the win.

When submitting results, enter Win if the player achieved the #1 Score Booster medal in their battle history, otherwise enter Lose.

rainmaker1.title: Astro's Modded Rainmaker #1
rainmaker1.description:
My team has been hard at work figuring out how we can make Splatoon 3 for the Nintendo Switch better! And what we found was YOU ALL HATE RAINMAKER. So I fixed the mode! You're Welcome!

This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Rainmaker. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Set the teams to match the groups of players on the results tab.

{Player} and {Player} are "Throwers" who win by making their team lose. The rest of the players' goal is to win the match. Throwers can use any (in game) means necessary to make their team lose the game. Use of voice calls for callouts is permitted.

When submitting results, enter Win by the team that won and enter Lose by the team that lost.

rainmaker2.title: Astro's Modded Rainmaker #2
rainmaker2.description:
My team has been hard at work figuring out how we can make Splatoon 3 for the Nintendo Switch better! And what we found was YOU ALL HATE RAINMAKER. So I fixed the mode again! You're Welcome!

This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Rainmaker. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Set the teams to match the groups of players on the results tab.

Your goal is to win the game of rainmaker but death is PERMANENT. Once your inkling or octoling dies once in game, you may not leave your spawner. If you accidentally leave your spawner, jump off the map to put yourself back. Use of voice calls for callouts is permitted. Any rule breaks will result in the offending team automatically losing.

When submitting results, enter Win by the team that won and enter Lose by the team that lost.

rainmaker3.title: Astro's Modded Rainmaker #3
rainmaker3.description:
My team has been hard at work figuring out how we can make Splatoon 3 for the Nintendo Switch better! And what we found was YOU ALL HATE RAINMAKER. So I fixed the mode for a third time! Be Grateful!

This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Rainmaker. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Set the teams to match the groups of players on the results tab.

Your goal is to win the game of rainmaker but your team can only pick-up the rainmaker ONCE. Obtaining any checkpoint allows your team a second pick-up of the rainmaker. If a player accidentally picks up the rainmaker when their team is not allowed to, they must not input anything on their controller until they lose possession of the rainmaker. Use of voice calls for callouts is permitted. Any rule breaks will result in the offending team automatically losing.

When submitting results, enter Win by the team that won and enter Lose by the team that lost.

kills.title: "Killer" Payout
kills.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Turf War. The host can pick their favorite map to play on.

Players will be seperated randomly into 2 teams. Your goal is get as many Kills/Assists as possible. You will recieve 1 Coin for every Kill/Assist. Weapon kits with Angle Shooter or Point Sensor are not allowed to be used.

When submitting results, enter the Kills/Assists value for each player on the latest Battle Log.

killtarget.title: A Dangerous Game of Chicken
killtarget.description:
This minigame is played together in Turf War.

Players will compete to see who can get the closest to 10 Kills/Assists without going over. If a player has more than 10 kills/assists in the battle log, they are awarded last place.

When submitting results, give 1st to the player closest to 10 kills/assists without going over. Give 2nd to the player second closest to 10 and so on.

worstmedal.title: Medal of Dishonor
worstmedal.description:
This minigame is played together in a Turf War lobby.

At the end of every match of splatoon, players recieve up to 3 medals that crown their accomplishments. Your goal is to achieve the worst medal possible. The value of a medal will be measured by it's Priority. A list of medals in order of highest priority to lowest can be found at splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Medal. All medals related to specials are considered to have the same priority.

Tip: Medals of higher priority will be shown before lower priority ones, make sure you don't earn too many higher priority medals.

When submitting results, enter 1st if the player achieved the Worst Medal in their battle history, enter 2nd if they had the second worst and so on. In the case where 2 players have the same Worst Medal, it is a tie, enter the same score for both of them.

protectpresident.title: Mr. President, GET DOWN!
protectpresident.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Turf War. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Set the teams to match the groups of players on the results tab.

{Player} and {Player} are "Throwers" who are attempting to be the player who dies to the enemy team the most times. All other players are attempting to kill the thrower on the enemy team the most times and prevent the thrower on their team from dying. The winner is determined by the death count of the throwers in the battle log. Throwers must use any Goo-Tuber weapon kit as their weapon to distinguish themselves from other players, no other player may use any Goo-Tuber kit. Throwers are not allowed to jump off of the map. Any rule breaks will result in the offending team automatically losing.

When submitting results, enter Win by the group with the red named player who died the least. Enter Lose by the group with the red named player who died the most.

speedrun1extra.title: Speedrun Race (3-1)
speedrun1extra.description:
This minigame is played individually in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level 3-1: Climbing the Corperate Splatter.

Players will play through level 3-1 as quickly as possible, you have 2 attempts to record a time. Play through the level the fastest to win! Your final time will be the time that shows up on the level clear screen. A penalty of 5 seconds will be added for each time you die in game.

When submitting results, enter 1 for the player with the fastest time, 2 for the 2nd fastest and so on. If 2 players have the same time, it is considered a tie. If a player does not remember their time, they are given last place.

speedrun2extra.title: Speedrun Race (5-11)
speedrun2extra.description:
This minigame is played individually in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level 5-11: Simply Zipcastic.

Players will play through level 5-11 as quickly as possible, you have 2 attempts to record a time. Play through the level the fastest to win! Your final time will be the time that shows up on the level clear screen. A penalty of 5 seconds will be added for each time you die in game.

When submitting results, enter 1 for the player with the fastest time, 2 for the 2nd fastest and so on. If 2 players have the same time, it is considered a tie. If a player does not remember their time, they are given last place.

speedrun3extra.title: Speedrun Race (5-3)
speedrun3extra.description:
This minigame is played individually in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level 5-3: Uh-Oh! Too Many Snipers!

Players will play through level 5-3 as quickly as possible, you have 2 attempts to record a time. Play through the level the fastest to win! Your final time will be the time that shows up on the level clear screen. A penalty of 5 seconds will be added for each time you die in game.

When submitting results, enter 1 for the player with the fastest time, 2 for the 2nd fastest and so on. If 2 players have the same time, it is considered a tie. If a player does not remember their time, they are given last place.

anarchyextra.title: Anarchy
anarchyextra.description:
This minigame is played together in Anarchy Open.

Players will play one match of Anarchy Open together. Your goal is to win. Simple enough.

When submitting results, enter Win if you won the match or Lose if you lost.

salmonrunextra.title: Overtime
salmonrunextra.description:
This minigame is played together in a Public Salmon Run Lobby.

Players will work together to clear the shift. Everyone wins if you clear all 3 waves.

When submitting results, enter Win if you cleared all 3 waves or Lose if you failed to clear all 3 waves.

killsextra.title: "Killer" Payout
killsextra.description:
This minigame is played together in a Public Turf War lobby.

Your goal is get as many Kills/Assists as possible. You will recieve 1 Coin for every Kill/Assist. Weapon kits with Angle Shooter or Point Sensor are not allowed to be used.

When submitting results, enter the Kills/Assists value for each player on the latest Battle Log.

survivalextra.title: Last Sal-Man Standing
survivalextra.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 200%. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Make sure all players select "?" as their weapon (This is the default option).

Players are competing to be the last squid standing. Whoever dies first gets last place, whoever dies second gets second last and so on. If the shift is failed while multiple players are still alive, they tie for first place. If it is unclear who died first between 2 players, all other players can vote who died first. If it is still unclear, it is a tie.

When submitting results, enter 1st by the player who died last, enter 2nd by the player who died second last and so on. In the case of ties, enter the same result for both of them.

goldeneggsextra.title: Over Fishing
goldeneggsextra.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 100% and the map to Bonerattle Arena. Make sure all players select "?" as their weapon (This is the default option).

Players will compete over the course of a salmon run shift to collect the most Golden Eggs. Players will recieve 1 coin for every 3 Golden Eggs collected.

When submitting results, enter the Golden Egg totals on the end screen.

goldeneggssolo.title: Over Fishing Solo
goldeneggssolo.description:
This minigame is played solo in a Freelance Salmon Run Lobby.

You will compete over the course of a salmon run shift to collect as many Golden Eggs as possible. You will recieve 1 coin for every 3 Golden Eggs you collect.

When submitting results, enter the number of Golden Egg you collected on the Recent Jobs tab in game. Not the total golden eggs collected by everyone.

killssolo.title: "Killer" Payout Solo
killssolo.description:
This minigame is played solo in Turf War.

Your goal is get as many Kills/Assists as possible. You will recieve 1 Coin for every Kill/Assist you get. Weapon kits with Angle Shooter or Point Sensor are not allowed to be used.

When submitting results, enter the Kills/Assists for your player on the latest Battle Log.

speedrunsolo.title: Speedrun Race Solo (3-6)
speedrunsolo.description:
This minigame is played solo in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level 3-6: Time Trial and Errors.

You will play through level 3-6 as quickly as possible, you have 2 attempts to record a time. Play through the level faster than AstroDwarf's prerecorded time to win! Your final time will be the time that shows up on the level clear screen. Astro did it in 49 seconds. If you die or the in game timer runs out while playing the level, you will automatically lose the race.

When submitting results, enter Win if you were faster or tied Astro's time of 0:51 otherwise enter Lose.

anarchysolo.title: Anarchy Solo
anarchysolo.description:
This minigame is played solo in Anarchy Open.

You will play one match of Anarchy Open. Your goal is to win. Simple enough.

When submitting results, enter Win if you won the match or Lose if you lost.

tableturfsolo.title: Tame the Terrible Toddler
tableturfsolo.description:
This minigame is played solo at the Offline Tableturf Battle Table. Select Lv.3 Baby Jelly as your opponent.

Your goal is to beat Baby Jelly in tableturf. This terrible toddler tends to throw tantrums, thus to triumph, trounce this toddlers tomfoolery through thorough Tableturf thrashing. Yes I used a thesaurus to make every word start with the letter T.

When submitting results, enter Win if you won against Baby Jelly and otherwise enter Lose if Baby Jelly won.

killsduel.title: Not a Team Player
killsduel.description:
This minigame is played together in a Turf War lobby. Players may choose to use any weapon that does not have point sensor or angle shooter as it's sub weapon.

Your goal is get as many Kills/Assists as possible. The player with the most kills/assists on the battle log wins the minigame.

When submitting results, enter Win for the player that had more Kills/Assists and enter Lose for the player with less.

survivalduel.title: Survival of the Fishest
survivalduel.description:
This minigame is played in a Private Salmon Run Lobby. Set the Hazard Level to 200%. The host can pick their favorite map to play on. Make sure all players select "?" as their weapon (This is the default option).

Both players are competing to be the last squid standing. Whoever dies first loses the duel. In the case where the shift is failed before either player dies or it is unclear who died first, it is a tie.

When submitting results, enter Win by the player who died last and enter Lose by the player who died first. In the case of a tie, enter either Win or Lose for both players.

goldeneggsduel.title: Gold Hoarders
goldeneggsduel.description:
This minigame is played together in a public Salmon Run lobby.

Mr. Grizz is offering a once in a lifetime all expenses paid vacation to the best performing employee this month. Your goal is to collect the most Golden Eggs during a shift of Salmon Run.

When submitting results, enter Win by the player who collected the most golden eggs in the battle history and enter Lose by the player with the least golden eggs.

tableturfduel.title: Tableturf Battle
tableturfduel.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Tableturf Battle lobby. You can play online tableturf by heading upstairs in the lobby. The host may pick their favorite map to play on. Set the turn timer to 40 seconds.

The goal of this game is the beat your opponent in a match of tableturf.

When submitting results, enter Win by the player who won and enter Lose by the player who lost.

splatzonesduel.title: Tiny Turf War
splatzonesduel.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Splat Zones. The host may pick their favorite map to play on.

Both players will be put onto opposing teams. The goal of the game is to win the game of splat zones.

When submitting results, enter Win by the player who won and enter Lose by the player who lost.

towercontrolduel.title: King of the Hill
towercontrolduel.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Tower Control. The host may pick their favorite map to play on.

Both players will be put onto opposing teams. The goal of the game is to win the game of tower control.

When submitting results, enter Win by the player who won and enter Lose by the player who lost.

clamblitzduel.title: Clam Blitz
clamblitzduel.description:
This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Clam Blitz. The host may pick their favorite map to play on.

Both players will be put onto opposing teams. The goal of the game is to win the game of clam blitz.

When submitting results, enter Win by the player who won and enter Lose by the player who lost.

rainmakerduel.title: Astro's Modded Rainmaker #4
rainmakerduel.description:
My team has been hard at work figuring out how we can make Splatoon 3 for the Nintendo Switch better! And what we found was YOU ALL HATE RAINMAKER. So I made it worse! You may now applaud!

This minigame is played together in a Private Battle lobby with the mode set to Rainmaker. The host can pick their favorite map to play on.

Both players will be put on opposing teams. Your goal is to win the game of rainmaker but if on the battle history you exceeded 600p of paint you will automatically lose despite the result of the match. If both players exceeded 600p of paint, the match is a tie.

Tip: You can use your special gague to estimate how much you have painted.

When submitting results, enter Win if the player won the match and did not exceed 600p of paint. Enter Lose if they did not win or exceeded 600p of paint. In the case of a tie, enter either Win or Lose for both players.

speedrunduel.title: Speedrun Race Duel (Crater-2)
speedrunduel.description:
This minigame is played individually in Alterna (aka Story Mode) on level Crater-2: Sink into the Ink and SWIM! If you are in Alterna, to enter the crater, press the A button on the Zapfish plush on the frist island.

Players will play through level Crater-2 as quickly as possible, you have 2 attempts to record a time. Play through the level the fastest to win! Your final time will be the time that shows up on the level clear screen. A penalty of 5 seconds will be added for each time you die in game.

When submitting results, enter Win for the player with the fastest time. Enter Lose for the player with the slower time. If both players have the same time, it is considered a tie, give both players either Win or Lose. If a player does not remember their time, they are given a loss.

gambleduel.title: Gambling Duel
gambleduel.description:
This minigame is played individually in the Lobby at the Shellout Machine.

Players will do a single pull from the Shellout Machine. Whoever get the rarest pull will win! If both players get the same pull it is considered a tie.

Rarities are as follows from rarest to most common: Gold, Silver, Bronze, Emote, Party Food Ticket, Pack of Cards, Banner, 2x Food Tickets, 3 Ability Chunks, Title, Stickers, Decorations, 50% Food Ticket, Drink Ticket

When submitting results, enter Win for the player with the rarer pull and enter Lose for the player with the more common pull. If the minigame ended in a tie, enter either Win or Lose for both players.
